image.altText: A woman in a pony tail and white top sits on a pink couch with shelves packed with books and trinkets behind her.

props.synopsis: Lorraine Jordan was an "approved occupant" of a social housing property in Tasmania, but when her son moved out her provider issued a trespass notice and changed the locks, locking her cat inside. Her legal win has given more rights to 4,300 people — but the government has appealed.

title.children: Social housing provider locked Lorraine's cat inside. Her legal win could affect thousands

image.altText: A person with long dark hair works on a computer with software code on two screens.

props.synopsis: With job availability in sectors such as healthcare and tech predicted to rise over the next 15 years, there is concern that some students are receiving outdated career guidance.

title.children: Fears Australia's kids aren't ready for jobs like automation engineer

image.altText: Sick Tasmanian devil

props.synopsis: A video showing a heavily emaciated Tasmanian devil is raising awareness on the impact of the deadly devil facial tumour disease.

title.children: 'Alien' Tasmanian devil with 'severe' facial tumour disease spotted on farm

image.altText: The side of a large ship in port.

props.synopsis: Negotiations to lease the newly built Spirit of Tasmania IV ferry have begun, as the state government announces the ship will stay on in Scotland for another month.

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania IV ferry to stay in Scotland until late February as lease offer considered

image.altText: a young man with long hair in a washed out photo

props.synopsis: John's brother Tony died in a motorcycle accident in the 1970s. But he's just discovered that parts of his brother's body may have been collected and stored in a museum after his autopsy, without the consent of family.

title.children: 'Traumatic': Family reacts after learning specimen from loved one may be in museum

image.altText: Ben Yole holds bridle of a horse.

props.synopsis: Leading Tasmanian harness racing trainer Ben Yole has had his racing licence disqualified for three years for the mistreatment of horses on his property at Sidmouth, near Launceston.

title.children: Leading harness trainer suspended over 'systemic' horse mistreatment

image.altText: A white background with black lines covering text and a sillhouette of a car, an eye symbol and an alien image embedded

props.synopsis: Before Donald Trump jumped on the bandwagon, suspicions have long surrounded some of America's biggest stories — and they're growing bigger and bigger.

title.children: The unredacted truth about America's conspiracy theory obsession

image.altText: A bald man wearing glasses and Adidas jacket sits in a car with a woman in Muslim head dress

props.synopsis: There are emotional scenes in the Middle East as three Israeli hostages and 183 Palestinian prisoners and detainees are released, as the ceasefire in Gaza reaches the end of its second week.

title.children: Ceasefire brings bittersweet reunions in Israel, the West Bank and Gaza

image.altText: Anthony Albanese exists a car in Perth.

props.synopsis: Labor won't try to negotiate the passage of the new laws, which would create a new federal Environment Protection Agency, in the coming sitting fortnight.

title.children: Labor shelves contentious environmental reform after backlash from WA

image.altText: A photo of missing woman Samantha Murphy in a formal floral dress.

props.synopsis: Samantha Murphy vanished on her morning run one year ago, and her home town of Ballarat is forever changed.

title.children: Samantha Murphy's hometown has changed since she disappeared a year ago

image.altText: an illustration of an unidentified young girl wearing a white dress facing away

props.synopsis: Two former homeschoolers who say they were denied a proper education are calling for mandatory home visits. But advocates say tighter regulations aren't the answer.

title.children: 'We weren't getting a proper education at all': Former homeschooler speaks out

image.altText: The back of millies head

props.synopsis: Selling your home is an occasion that would normally call for celebration, but for Millie, it's a day marked with feelings of betrayal, defeat and grief.

title.children: The legal loopholes permitting 'sexually transmitted tax debt'

image.altText: Flooded backyard

props.synopsis: A woman has died after an emergency services boat flipped in floodwater in north Queensland as Townsville residents evacuate.

title.children: North Queensland facing flood disaster, with prospect of 'record rainfall'

image.altText: Chief Justice Andrew Bell in a suit

props.synopsis: With artificial intelligence set to be restricted in New South Wales' legal system from Monday, the state's Chief Justice has flagged his concerns over the technology.

title.children: AI restrictions within NSW’s legal system days from implementation

image.altText: a photo of a CFA tanker parked with blaze on a hill in the background

props.synopsis: Residents living in Mirranatwa have been told to leave immediately due to the bushfire in the Grampians/Gariwerd National Park.

title.children: Emergency warning issued for town near Grampians/Gariwerd blaze

image.altText: A pair of hands holding two different pineapples of a different size and shape, other pineapples are visible below

props.synopsis: Growers fear the time it takes to cut up a pineapple and clean the mess off the chopping board is behind flatlining sales.

title.children: Time-poor Aussies leave 'inconvenient' fruits off the shopping list

image.altText: An aerial photo shows layers of crystal clear water, white sand, green shrubbery and pink lake water.

props.synopsis: For years, Lake Hillier was one of Western Australia's most photogenic attractions. Now, tour operators have stopped flying over it.

title.children: Iconic pink lake loses its 'bubble-gum' hue, but can it bounce back?

image.altText: Dinesh Chandimal Matthew Kuhnemann and Jeffrey Vandersay

props.synopsis: Dinesh Chandimal achieves something rarely seen, a forgettable moment for an ex-captain and a record low in Sri Lanka's proud Test history. Here are the quick hits from day four of the first Test in Galle.

title.children: Quick hits: Star's unwanted feat as nightmare dismissal sums up low

image.altText: A politician in a suit with a white shirt walking into a building.

props.synopsis: When South Australian Liberal MP Tim Whetstone faced a challenge to his candidacy, the decision came down to just a few politically engaged party members in his electorate.

title.children: Dwindling membership leaves candidates' fate in hands of engaged few

image.altText: A composite image of political volunteers from Labor, the Greens and an independent.

props.synopsis: The cost of living looks set to be the biggest issue at the WA election. But analysts say teal-tinged independent candidates and the Greens, campaigning strongly on climate change, could put a dent in Labor’s vote and pick up some key seats.

title.children: Appetite for climate action likely to affect Labor's chances in safe WA seat

image.altText: A crowd of people, one carrying a campaign sign for Angelica Di Camillo, cross a pedestrian crossing towards a market.

props.synopsis: Stabbings and firebombings in the popular Chapel Street strip dominate news headlines, but a more localised crime wave could sway voters in next week's Prahran by-election.

title.children: Crime, cost of living up as Prahran head into a by-election

image.altText: woman sitting on motorcycle wearing helmet in front of pub

props.synopsis: Many Australians aim to retire at 65 but not Alice Bennett. The Barcaldine resident takes great pride serving coffees at a major pub in town.

title.children: Meet the outback barista who found a new career in her seventies

image.altText: A man and woman in a carriage, dressed in formal wear, pulled by a black horse team

props.synopsis: World champion carriage driver Boyd Exell returns home to Australia this year to help students learn the ropes of a sport with royal roots.

title.children: A carriage-driving master brings his skills back home

image.altText: An aircrew sitting underneath a twin-engined bomber as another bomber takes off in the background.

props.synopsis: Bert O'Leary, who just celebrated his 100th birthday, shares the terror and drudgery of life as airman aboard a Vickers Wellington in the Battle of the Atlantic.

title.children: 100yo RAAF airman recalls 'needle in a haystack' hunt for WWII U-boats

image.altText: A woman in a pony tail and white top sits on a pink couch with shelves packed with books and trinkets behind her.

props.synopsis: Lorraine Jordan was an "approved occupant" of a social housing property in Tasmania, but when her son moved out her provider issued a trespass notice and changed the locks, locking her cat inside. Her legal win has given more rights to 4,300 people — but the government has appealed.

title.children: Tenancy rights tested as social housing provider changes locks with cat inside

image.altText: A closeup of a man pouring cooking oil into frying pan in kitchen.

props.synopsis: Using a smaller number of versatile cooking oils can help you save precious pantry real estate and money. We asked experts how to make the most of them with taste, budget and health in mind.

title.children: Choosing the right cooking oils can save you money and pantry space

image.altText: Chappell Roan wears a suit of armour as she performs at the 2024 MTV VMAs

props.synopsis: Everything you need to know about this week's Grammy Awards: who's nominated, who's playing, and how to watch.

title.children: Everything you need to know about this week's Grammy Awards

image.altText: Two women pose for the camera.

props.synopsis: After a decade of street activism in Wollongong, the HONK! Oz street music festival now has a treasure trove of photographic memories.

title.children: Photographers capture musicians at street festival creating a decade-long record

image.altText: fire and smoke above a row of two story houses

props.synopsis: The plane, a Learjet 55, was carrying a child patient, her mother and four other people when it crashed at a busy intersection near Roosevelt Mall in Philadelphia.

title.children: 'She was going home': Child on medivac jet dies in fiery US crash tragedy

image.altText: Three abalone shells sitting on a hessian sack.

props.synopsis: Divers off the coast of Port MacDonnell made a grim discovery last February, finding a disease that has sent shockwaves through the abalone industry.

title.children: SA's abalone industry on high alert as 'devastating' disease spreads

image.altText: A woman holds a ball behind her head as if she will throw it. She has a tattooed arm.

props.synopsis: With the Asian Cup, World Cup and Olympics taking place in the next three years, the Matildas needed to re-fresh their squad. These are the faces bringing the spark back to Australia's beloved side.

title.children: Meet the Matildas shaping a new era for Australian women's football

image.altText: Australia's Davis Cup team pose for a photo after defeating Sweden in a tie in Stockholm.

props.synopsis: Olympic champions John Peers and Matt Ebden reunite to deliver Australia an emphatic Davis Cup triumph over Sweden in Stockholm.

title.children: Aussies seal Davis Cup win over Sweden

image.altText: A man on a bodyboard surfing in the barrel section of a large wave.

props.synopsis: Former world bodyboard champion Damian King is preparing to take on Hawaii's Pipeline, more than a decade after he last competed at the famous break.

title.children: King out of retirement and 'pumped' to take on Pipeline
